column2: Recruitment: Ongoing sourcing, review, and interview of applicants for various roles in the company. Help set up interviews with functional managers and leadership. Finally, negotiate salaries, roll out offers, and help onboard new employees.          Payroll HR: Set up and manage HRIS for all employees and ensure systematic tracking and approvals for leaves, expenses, benefits, salary disbursements, and related areas.          Operations: Support management by ensuring teams are productive and using existing tools and processes. This includes some level of project management and coordination.          Invoice Management: Coordinate with finance and client management teams to ensure timely billing and follow-ups. Work with leadership to help grow the business and revenues.          Job requirements          Education: Graduation or masters in management, finance, HR, operations, or a related field.          Experience: Freshers may apply, ideally, candidates with at least 1-2 years of experience are preferred.          Communication: Excellent spoken and written English skills are critical.          Detail-orientation: Since you will be working with numbers and juggling various complexities, you must be extremely focused and allow for zero errors at all times.          Systematic: You may seek guidance from management, and also have the freedom to set up your own processes and systems to help ensure smooth, and error-free operations.          Leadership: Overall, this role offers opportunities to work with management and gives you exposure to all key business areas. You may use this as an opportunity to grow rapidly and take up a future management and leadership role.          As an HR Executive, youll play a vital role in our organization by:        Providing support and guidance to employees on any HR-related questions or concerns          Collaborating with cross-functional teams to drive HR initiatives and projects that enhance our work culture          Building and maintaining strong employee relationships and resolving any conflicts with empathy and understanding          Recruiting and onboarding new team members and creating a positive company culture          Ensuring that our HR practices align with relevant laws and regulations          Keeping accurate and organized employee files and HR databases          Developing and implementing HR policies and procedures that foster a supportive and inclusive work environment

Employee relations:  Employee relations (ER) refer to a company?? efforts to manage relationships in an organization. HR Ops focuses on preventing and resolving issues between coworkers and management. They also concentrate on understanding how your staff feels about their job, company environment, and overall well-being.?? Offboarding:  Offboarding happens when an employee has either decided to leave the company or was fired. It involves administrative tasks like ensuring the employee returns company property, notifying IT and payroll about personnel changes, and preparing any paperwork the employee might need to sign. Offboarding also involves exit interviews, which are conversations between the employee, manager/HR, and the leadership team. During this chat, HR Operations is looking for feedback from the leaving team member on how to create a better work environment and employee experience for the current and future employees.?

From recruitment and onboarding to performance management and employee relations, your role will contribute to fostering a positive work environment aligned with our values. column2: Role & responsibilities   As a Knowledge Solutions Specialist for HR Ops Process is a critical role. A Knowledge Solutions Specialist is responsible for managing knowledge-related processes within an organization. Their key duties and responsibilities include: Here are the key elements of people management encompassed in this role: Knowledge Management:  Developing, implementing, and maintaining knowledge management strategies and systems to improve information sharing and collaboration. Content Creation:  Creating and curating knowledge resources, such as documentation, manuals, FAQs, and best practices, to ensure accurate and up-to-date information is readily available to employees and customers. Training and Support:  Providing training and support to employees on knowledge management tools and processes to enhance their understanding and usage. Information Retrieval:  Ensuring effective search capabilities for knowledge repositories to enable quick access to relevant information. Continuous Improvement:  Identifying areas for improvement in knowledge management practices and suggesting innovative solutions to enhance efficiency. Knowledge Transfer:  Facilitating knowledge transfer among team members and departments to prevent knowledge silos and foster a learning culture. Quality Assurance:  Reviewing and verifying the accuracy and relevance of knowledge resources regularly. Collaboration:  Collaborating with different teams and stakeholders to gather knowledge requirements and align knowledge initiatives with organizational goals. Metrics and Analytics:  Tracking and analyzing key performance indicators related to knowledge management, such as usage metrics and user feedback, to measure effectiveness and identify opportunities for improvement. Stay Updated:  Keeping up-to-date with industry best practices and emerging trends in knowledge management to implement cutting-edge solutions. Communication and Feedback:  Establish open channels of communication with the Product Owners and Workstream Owners, encouraging regular feedback and suggestions for process improvement. Keep team members informed about organizational changes, updates, and strategic decisions  Preferred candidate profile   Proactive problem solving capabilities with the ability to multi task and resolve issues in a fast paced environment. Collaborate with key stakeholders to ensure that the right content on process and policy changes are available to TIAA employees and the HRIS teams.  Sound and comprehensive communication and diplomacy skills are required to exchange complex information. At least 10+ years of experience In HR Ops and Internal Associate Communication / policy writing / content creation within the HR domain. Functional and technical knowledge of HR systems, workday experience preferred.  Sound with excel and Power point skills. Excellent communication and inter-personal skills.

column2: Maersk is searching for colleagues supporting colleagues At Maersk we have a vision thats larger than the ocean: to be a true integrator of container logistics connecting and simplifying our customers supply chain through global end-to-end solutions. We count on our people to make it happen. That is why we are building a new global HR service enabled by new technology: to make sure we deliver great experience to our people, so they can deliver great experience to our customers. The HR organisation of the Future will work across brands, geographies and cultures to support one global Maersk. Next to the Centers of Expertise (CoE) and the strategic HR Business Partners, the Employee Experience Organisation is the largest part of the new HR organisation and the closest to our people. To enable our future HR service delivery model, we are establishing three Employee Experience Hubs covering geographical regions: Bangalore, India, covering IMEA; Lisbon, Portugal, covering Europe; and San Jos, Costa Rica, covering the Americas and Chengdu, China, covering APA. We are looking for Specialists to join the Global Data Quality & Platforms team, one of the pillars of People Advisory Services, to support the People function across the globe. What we offer  You will be part of the team that is the first point of contact for employees and leaders, helping them solve HR queries online, on the phone or on site.  Whether their issue is big or small, our people should feel cared for just the same and your role is making sure they have a great experience when they reach out to HR . You will furthermore support the delivery of the HR Cycle with administrative tasks related to onboarding, annual performance management, job moves, exit, etc. You will join the team as we prepare to go live with Workday and will therefore be initially spending your time on supporting implementation related activities and your colleagues in the other HR delivery teams. This is also an excellent opportunity to start familiarising yourself deeply with the future processes, technology (Workday also our knowledge and case management tool) ahead of the People Hub being fully operational. You will have a unique opportunity to stretch your capabilities by learning from, sparring with and building lasting relationships with diverse and professional colleagues all over the world. The role is based in the Employee Experience Hub in  Bangalore, India.  The Employee Experience hub is a truly international HR support center where you will work alongside, learn from and build lasting relationships with colleagues from all over the world. Joining Maersk, you will become part of the global family of the company that moves 20% of global trade everyday all the way, where one of our core values is Our Employees. It goes without saying that we value diversity: we thrive on the diversity of our talent in all its forms, and we see it as a strength in building high performance teams across brands, cultures, and locations. Key responsibilities You will join the Global Data Quality & Platforms team early on as we prepare to start delivery of our services. In this time, you will be spending your time on implementation related activities such as designing the data quality framework, implementing data rules, establishing sanity checks, data gathering, project steering, etc. For this you will:  Own to resolve peoples issues received through a variety of channels in a timely manner by adhering to the defined SLA.  Work together with Managers, People Partners, and various functional specialists across the globe to solve complex queries.  Prepare and handle HR newsletters; identify data issues and correct them. ??Maintain data sanity on Workday.  Support improvement activities to simplify and standardize the HR processes.  Deliver on high employee satisfaction, accuracy, and timeliness. Who we are looking for:  Saying that you should be customer-oriented is an understatement: we need you to be passionate about employee experience! You have high energy and drive and efficiently manage resolution of every employee query. As for the skillset and experience, we are looking for:  3+ Years of experience working on  Workday , delivering services for  Europe region , preferably from a shared service center environment.  Passion for working on huge volumes of data with an eye for details.  Fluent in English and experience working in multi culture global teams.  Strong knowledge of Workday Products like  WD Journey, WD Help,   Workday Org Studio and WD Reports.  Ability to perform under high pressure/workload environment.  Experience working with  Service Now  would be an asset.  Strong communication and problem-solving skills.  Drive to identify needs, investigate options, seek solutions and partner with other HR colleagues to resolve open issues.  Ability to take initiative, manage multiple priorities and work in a fast-paced environment.  Ability to be an engaged member of a virtual team.  Closure orientation and low tolerance for delays and deviations.  Knowledge of HR concepts are a strong plus.  Experience actioning mass changes via  EIB on WD .  Thorough understanding of Business Processes of various models in WD like HCM, Absence, Performance, etc. Shift timings:  12pm to 9pm You have been reading so far, were are glad to see you are interested. If you could see yourself in this role and are keen to be part of the journey to establish a world-class People Advisory function at Maersk, we look forward to hearing from you!

column2: Job Description: HR Compliance and Payroll Specialist Overview: We are seeking an experienced HR Compliance and Payroll Specialist to oversee all aspects of HR compliance, taxation, and payroll processing within our organization. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in labor laws, taxation regulations, and payroll management, coupled with exceptional attention to detail and organizational skills. Responsibilities: HR Compliance Management:  Ensure adherence to all relevant labor laws, regulations, and company policies. Regularly review and update HR policies and procedures to ensure compliance with changing laws and industry standards. Manage and ensure compliance with all PF, ESIC, LWF, PT, minimum wages and Gratuity return filing requirements. Oversee the timely and accurate processing of claims related to PF, ESIC, and other statutory benefits. Coordinate with relevant authorities for enrollment processes and maintain up-to-date records of employee contributions. Stay informed about changes in labor laws, regulations, and statutory requirements, and implement necessary updates to company policies and procedures. Conduct periodic audits to assess compliance levels and identify areas for improvement. Taxation Compliance:  Stay abreast of tax laws and regulations at the local, state, and federal levels. Coordinate with tax consultants or authorities to ensure accurate and timely tax filings, including income tax, payroll tax, and other statutory deductions. Payroll Processing:  Oversee end-to-end payroll processing, including data collection, calculation of wages, deductions, and benefits. Verify accuracy of payroll data and resolve any discrepancies. Process payroll in compliance with applicable laws and regulations. Benefits Administration:  Administer employee benefits programs, including health insurance, retirement plans, and other fringe benefits. Ensure timely enrolment, changes, and termination of benefits as per employee status and company policies. Record Keeping:  Maintain accurate and up-to-date employee records, including attendance, leave balances, and personal information. Ensure confidentiality and security of employee data in compliance with privacy regulations. Reporting and Analysis:  Prepare regular reports on payroll expenses, tax liabilities, and compliance metrics for management review. Conduct periodic audits to ensure accuracy and integrity of payroll data. Employee Relations:  Provide guidance and support to employees on payroll-related inquiries, deductions, and tax implications. Address any concerns or issues related to payroll processing promptly and professionally. Training and Development:  Conduct training sessions for HR staff and managers on payroll procedures, compliance requirements, and best practices. Keep the HR team informed about updates or changes in labor laws and taxation regulations. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Accounting, Business Administration, or related field. 5-8 years of experience in HR compliance, taxation, and payroll management. Expertise in labor laws, taxation regulations, and payroll processing. Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy. Excellent knowledge of payroll software and MS Office applications. Ability to handle confidential information with integrity and discretion. Effective communication and interpersonal skills. Certification in HR management or payroll administration is a plus.

column2: Company: Sea Freight & Logistics Solution About Us: Sea Freight & Logistics Solution  is a leading freight forwarding company dedicated to providing reliable and efficient logistics solutions. We pride ourselves on our commitment to excellence and our ability to deliver exceptional services to our clients. As we continue to grow, we are looking for a dynamic and experienced HR Executive to join our team and contribute to our success. Job Summary: The HR Executive will play a crucial role in fostering a positive work environment, enhancing employee engagement, and ensuring compliance with all statutory requirements related to payroll and employee benefits. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in HR operations, excellent organizational skills, and a proactive approach to problem-solving. Key Responsibilities: Employee Retention and Engagement: Develop and implement employee retention strategies to reduce turnover and increase job satisfaction. Organize and manage employee engagement programs, including team-building activities, recognition programs, and feedback initiatives. Conduct regular surveys and feedback sessions to understand employee needs and address concerns promptly. Payroll and Statutory Compliance: Oversee the accurate calculation and timely distribution of salaries, including bonuses, incentives, and other compensations. Ensure compliance with statutory requirements related to Provident Fund (PF), Employee State Insurance (ESI), and other applicable labor laws. Manage the timely payment and filing of statutory contributions and taxes, including TDS, PF, ESI, and professional tax. HR Operations: Maintain accurate and up-to-date employee records, including personal information, job roles, and salary details. Assist in the recruitment process, including job postings, screening, interviewing, and onboarding of new employees. Provide support and guidance to employees regarding HR policies, benefits, and procedures. Qualifications and Skills: Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. Minimum of 3 years of experience in HR roles, preferably in the logistics or freight forwarding industry. Strong knowledge of payroll processes, statutory compliance, and labor laws. Excellent organizational and time-management skills. Proficient in HR software and Microsoft Office Suite. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to handle confidential information with integrity and discretion. Why Join Us? Opportunity to work with a dynamic and growing company in the logistics industry. Competitive salary and benefits package. Supportive work environment with a focus on professional development. Chance to make a significant impact on employee satisfaction and company culture. How to Apply: Interested candidates are invited to submit their resume and a cover letter detailing their experience and qualifications to info@seafreightlogistic.com with the subject line "HR Executive Application - [Your Name]". Sea Freight & Logistics Solution  is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. This job description outlines the responsibilities, qualifications, and application process for the HR Executive role in your company. It emphasizes the importance of employee engagement, retention, and statutory compliance, ensuring candidates understand the critical aspects of the job.
